newsitem.title: MALTA: Malta government deficit falls in first half 1996.
newsitem.headline: Malta government deficit falls in first half 1996.

text.p: The Maltese government cut its deficit to 36.3 million lira ($98.1 million) in the first half of 1996 compared to 41.9 million in the same period of 1995, the Central Office of Statistics said.
Revenue rose by 29.2 million lira to 239.9 million while expenditure rose by 23.6 million to 276.2 million.
The office said the government benefitted from higher revenues from value added tax, income tax, succession duty and social security contributions but income from customs and excise fell.
Most of the increase in spending was recurrent expenditure, although capital expenditure was up three percent. ($1=0.37 Maltese lira)
